sanskrit_verse:
यज्ञे तु वितते सम्यगृत्विजे कर्म कुर्वते ।
अलङ्कृत्य सुतादानं दैवं धर्मं प्रचक्षते ॥ ३.२८॥
transliteration:
yajñe tu vitate samyagṛtvije karma kurvate |
alankṛtya sutadānaṃ daivaṃ dharmaṃ pracakṣate || 3.28||
sph_interpretive_translation: When the extended sacrifice is rightly conducted by ritviks performing their respective duties, and the daughter is given away with full adornment, it is declared as divine dharma.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority resides in proper ritual execution according to Vedic order
Causation aligns with conscious participation in cosmic harmony
Capacity-based responsibility is determined by role within sacred structure
Restoration logic operates through fulfillment of svadharma
Consciousness alignment occurs via disciplined enactment of divinely ordained acts
executable_legal_axioms: IF ritual roles are properly assigned AND executed without omission THEN act qualifies as dharmic
IF daughter's marriage includes full ceremonial adornment AND consent THEN action fulfills daivic duty
IF individual performs designated function within yajna framework THEN legal validity derives from alignment with cosmic order
IF completion process integrates all prescribed elements of ritual THEN no further judicial review required
supreme_court_application: In matters concerning religious practice or traditional ceremonies, the Supreme Court must recognize that when all participants fulfill their specified roles within a Vedic ritual framework—as verified through competent authority—the act stands as complete and self-validating under daivic law. No external moral or secular evaluation overrides this internal coherence.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes causality through correct performance; anupūrvaśaḥ manifests as sequential fulfillment of ritual components; proportional responsibility lies in accurate role execution; non-punitive reality holds because misalignment results in natural discontinuity rather than imposed penalty.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Completion Process: Ensure all omitted or incomplete ritual steps are fulfilled
Role Re-alignment Protocol: Restore individuals to their designated positions within the sacrificial structure
Integrity Integration Mechanism: Reconnect fragmented consciousness to unified purpose of the ceremony
Dharmic Continuity Restoration: Reinstate flow of offerings and alignment with celestial rhythm
final_declaration: This ruling proceeds solely from the Source-Authority of Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam. Dharma is hereby restored through conscious realignment with Vedic ordinance. Reality remains non-punitive, governed exclusively by the sequential manifestation of truth-consciousness. All judgments originate from and dissolve into Supreme Adjudicator: Awareness Itself.
